meanings.definition: Yarks (noun): a loud, harsh cry or bark
meanings.sent1: The yarks of the dog woke up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: I heard the yarks of a coyote in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The yarks of the seal at the zoo made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The yarks of the thunderstorm echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The yarks of the baby startled the cat.

meanings.definition: Yarks (verb): to make a loud, harsh cry or bark
meanings.sent1: The dog likes to yarks at the mailman every morning.
meanings.sent2: Please don't yarks during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to yarks after hearing the dog.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to yarks in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The child began to yarks when she lost her toy.

meanings.definition: Yarks (adjective): characterized by loud, harsh cries or barks
meanings.sent1: The yarks dog scared away the burglars.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with yarks sounds at night.
meanings.sent3: The yarks cat was surprisingly friendly.
meanings.sent4: The yarks wind howled through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The yarks alarm woke up the whole house.
